explanation.text:
Explanation
A constitution is defined as a body of agreed rules and principles stating how the powers of governing a country are given and how these powers are to be exercised.
Option C is the correct answer. 
There is an explanation video available below.

text: A constitution is a legal document _________

options.text: forming the basis upon which a government rules the country
only likely to succeed in countries where there is union government

subject: GOVERNMENT

explanation.text:
Explanation
An oligarchy is a form of government that places power in the hands of a few people.
There is an explanation video available below.

text: A government in which control of ultimate power is by a few who rule in their selfish interest is classified as _________
subject: GOVERNMENT

explanation.text:
Explanation
The judicial organ of government performs various functions which include; punishment of offenders, settlement of disputes, safeguarding rights, protection of constitution etc. However, in summary, it is the body that interprets the law of the state. 
There is an explanation video available below.

text: The judicial organ of government is the body which _________
subject: GOVERNMENT

explanation.text:
Explanation
The 1979 constitution tried to avoid the pitfalls of the First Republic by establishing the options above except for option  B
There is an explanation video available below.

text: Which of the following was not established by the 1979 Nigerian constitution ?
subject: GOVERNMENT

explanation.text:
Explanation
Local government generates revenue through the collection of rates on radio and television, market shops, motor parks etc 
There is an explanation video available below.

text: Rates are generally collected in Nigeria by ________
subject: GOVERNMENT

explanation.text:
Explanation
Democracy is concentrated on the people, the people's ability to exercise power directly or through a representative.
There is an explanation video available below.

text: In a democracy, sovereignty is in _________
subject: GOVERNMENT

explanation.text:
Explanation
Confederalism is a system of organization in which there is a union of states with each state retaining some independent control on both internal and external affairs. ECOWAS  is located in Nigeria with the purpose of promoting regional cooperation and economic integration.
There is an explanation video available below.

text: Which of the following is a good example of a confederal state?
subject: GOVERNMENT

explanation.text:
Explanation
A public bill is one that has to do with the issues confronting the country. 
There is an explanation video available below.

text: A bill that applies to the whole population and is intended to promote the general welfare is called _________
subject: GOVERNMENT

explanation.text:
Explanation
Fascism was developed in Italy under Benito Mussolini

text: Fascism developed in________
subject: GOVERNMENT

explanation.text:
Explanation
Separation of Powers was first formulated by Baron de Montesquieu

text: The theory of separation of powers was first time clearly formulated by __________
subject: GOVERNMENT

explanation.text:
Explanation
Facism is a form of government headed by a dictator, in which government has a total control over all activities in the state. 
There is an explanation video available below.

text: A system of government in which power derives from total control of the instruments of force is called ___________
subject: GOVERNMENT

explanation.text:
Explanation
On 1 January 1900, the Royal Niger Company transferred its territories to the British Government.

text: The British Government revoked the charter of the Royal Niger Company and took over the direct administration of Nigeria in _________
subject: GOVERNMENT

explanation.text:
Explanation
Federal character and inequality was not a part of the 1979 constitution fundamentals

text: The Fundamental Objectives and Directive Principles of State Policy in the 1979 constitution do not include _________

options.text: concentration of wealth and provision of maximum welfare

subject: GOVERNMENT

subject: GOVERNMENT

subject: GOVERNMENT

explanation.text:
Explanation
Sovereignty means the supreme power and authority of the state.

text: When a state is subject to no other authority, it is said to be _________
subject: GOVERNMENT

explanation.text:
Explanation
A political party is defined as an organized group of citizens, who act together as a political unit, who act together as a political unit, having distinctive aims and objectives involving political questions in the state and acting together and seeking to obtain control of government
There is an explanation video available below.

text: While pressure groups aim at influencing government decisions, the primary aim of political parties is to ______

options.text: promote the welfare of their members
influence legislation in order to benefit their members

subject: GOVERNMENT

subject: GOVERNMENT

subject: GOVERNMENT

 Vote power is exercised in the security council within the United States

Explanation
Law is a system of rules created which regulates behaviour.

explanation.text:
Explanation
An independent judiciary is one which is free from the interference of the other two arms of government, the executive and legislative.

subject: GOVERNMENT

explanation.text:
Explanation
The rule of law can be constrained by invoking emergency powers. For instance, if there is a war, a state of emergency could be declared. Bad leaders may be enthroned and citizens may be denied of some of their rights.
There is an explanation video available below.

text: The application of the rule of law may be constrained by ________

options.text: securing the tenure of office of judges
employing men of proven integrity as judges

subject: GOVERNMENT

explanation.text:
Explanation
Judicial Committee of Privy Council is the highest court of appeal for British Territories established on 13th, August 1833.
There is an explanation video available below.

text: The highest court in Nigeria before 1963 was the _________

options.text: Judicial Committees of the Privy Council

subject: GOVERNMENT

explanation.text:
Explanation
New appointed military governors were not given seats on the supreme military council, but instead were expected to administer federal policies handed by Muritala Muhammad.
There is an explanation video available below.

text: A feature unique to General Murtala Muhammed's Supreme Military Council as compared to that of General Yakubu Gowon was the _________

options.text: inclusion of the civilians as members
exclusion of military governors from the council
inclusion of the chief justice as a member
the exclusion of the Inspector General of police from the council

subject: GOVERNMENT

explanation.text:
Explanation
The United State of America refused to license the sales of arms to the federal government, as a result, Nigerians were reluctant to interact with USA and turned to the Soviet Union who supplied the federal government arms.

text: In the First Republic, Nigeria was very reluctant to have meaningful interaction with ________
subject: GOVERNMENT

explanation.text:

The major purpose of U.N.O. is to keep peace throughout the world. The Gulf war was a disruption of peace, an indication that UNO is unable to ensure permanent world peace.

text: The Gulf War of 1990 is an indication that the U. N. O. is unable to _______

explanation.text:

One of the disadvantages of plurality electoral system is the possibility of rigging the election in this system

text: The simple plurality electoral system is often criticized because _________

options.text: the ruling party may lose the election
the winner may not poll an absolute majority
it works against all opposition parties

Cote d'Ivoire 1958
Algeria 1962
Tanzania 1961

explanation.text:
Explanation
Non-alignment means the non-commitment of a nation on any international issue.
Option B is the correct answer
There is an explanation video available below.

text: Nigeria's non-aligned policy means that she will _________

options.text: have nothing to do with the superpowers
not take sides in international issues based on ideological considerations
avoid having any dealing with any country with ideological learnings
relate only with member countries of the Non-Aligned movement

subject: GOVERNMENT

text: The charter of the United Nations was drawn up in ________

text: The idea of making the civil service permanent, neutral and anonymous is to _________

options.text: make civil servants a functional elite

subject: GOVERNMENT

explanation.text:
Explanation
Electoral Commission is a body charged with organizing and conducting all elections in the country. Delineation of constituencies is the division of a country into constituencies.

subject: GOVERNMENT
